title.rendered: The Grand Slam Favorite Winners of All Time

content.rendered:
Winning a Grand Slam title is every tennis player’s dream since the day he started swinging a racket.

Grand Slam tournaments have been difficult to win, but many names have dominated the biggest stages over the years. There is a player who has made history by winning a record number of Grand Slam titles, especially in the last 20 years.

Which are the 4 Grand Slam tournaments?

His four Grand Slam events that are held each year are the Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open.

The French Open is played on clay, Wimbledon on grass, and the other two on hard courts.

Wimbledon is the oldest Grand Slam event, founded in 1877, followed four years later by the US Open, the 1891 French Open, and the 1905 Australian Open. 4,444 Rafael Nadal and Margaret Court currently hold the record for the most Grand Slam titles in their respective disciplines.

Nadal recently won the 2022 Australian Open, where Roger Federer and Novak made him the sole men’s singles record holder, surpassing Djokovic. He then extended his lead at the French Open before Djokovic fell within one at Wimbledon.

Swiss icon Federer has no chance of extending his Grand Slam success after announcing his retirement after the Laver Cup in September 2022

Most Grand Slam titles won by a player in men’s singles

Most Grand Slam titles won by a player in women’s singlesPlayer’s Grand Slam titles           

Who has won All in a year?

The term “Grand Slam” refers to him winning all four tournaments in the same year.

Winning one title is hard enough, but winning all four titles in a row is very difficult.

USA’s Don Budge was the first player to complete a Grand Slam in 1938, and Australia’s Rod Laver is the only men’s singles player to repeat the feat.

Maureen Connolly was the first woman to compete in women’s singles in 1953. Margaret Court and Steffi Graf are the only other players to do the same.

Dylan Olcott was the last player to complete a Grand Slam in his quad singles in a wheelchair in 2021.

What is the Golden Slam?

If Grand Slams are not uncommon, the Golden Slam requires winning four Grand Slam events in the same year plus an Olympic gold medal.

Steffi Graf was the first player to complete the Golden Slam in 1988, and since then only wheelchair players Die Dede his Groot and Dylan his Olcott have been able to repeat the feat.

Read more: BCCI Representative may lead ICC’s Finance and Commercial Affairs Committee
